author: 0w3n6325
content:
"It's also compatible with BALs (EIP-7928) since decrypted transactions are known before the builder constructs the block."

Just curious about this point. The builder of the block the the STs are included in won't know the decrypted transactions before constructing the block. Only the builder of the following block will know that.

So this isn't any different to what would happen in EIP 8105 right?

author: robocopsgonemad
content: well no, the builder needs to know them so it can execute them to get a stateroot. it's the prior block that committed to them.

author: 0w3n6325
content: Which builder needs to know them? Builder of the block in slot N or N + 1?

author: 0w3n6325
content:
In 8105 the encrypted tx is included at the bottom of block N and then decrypted and executed at the start of block N + 1.

It seems to me the same thing happens in LUCID.
